The duneworm cannot be stopped or affected in any way, must pass through one of the thumper's spaces, and can only move orthogonally (no diagonals). Any characters it passes through must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take [10 Physical] and are pushed 5 spaces in the direction of the duneworm's movement. Success: Half damage.
As the user of this item, you are immune to this effect, choose where the duneworm appears and the path it uses, and can choose to slide along with the duneworm's movement as long as they're in its path.
Each character can only be affected by any given duneworm 1/turn. If the Duneworm Thumper is not destroyed by the end of the scene, you regain the Consumable charge spent on it.
You can attack up to two different targets within this weapon's reach. If you attack two targets, the attacks deal [1d6 Physical] instead.
You can replace one of the traits from your currently equipped job with a trait from a different job you know.
This item can hold a spell with the Summon tag. This item is considered to be that spell (and is treated as a spell), but it does not cost MEMORY to equip.
You can make reaction attacks with this weapon, but the damage becomes [1d6 Physical] when doing so.
Whenever you would take more than 5 damage from one source (before ARMOR and resistance), it is instead reduced to 5 damage.
